title: Peter Kunter
text:
Peter Kunter (born 28 April 1941 in <a href="Berlin">Berlin</a>, Germany) is a former professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Playing for <a href="Eintracht%20Wetzlar">Eintracht Wetzlar</a>, Kunter was capped for the German youth national team in 1958, amassing nine appearances. Afterwards he played four times for the amateur national team. From 1961 on, Kunter studied <a href="dentistry">dentistry</a>, sports and German studies in <a href="Freiburg">Freiburg</a> while playing for second tier <a href="Freiburger%20FC">Freiburger FC</a>. In 1965, he moved to <a href="Eintracht%20Frankfurt">Eintracht Frankfurt</a>, amassing 234 <a href="Bundesliga">Bundesliga</a> games and 17 games in <a href="DFB-Pokal">DFB-Pokal</a> and <a href="UEFA%20Cup">UEFA Cup</a>/<a href="UEFA%20Cup%20Winners%27%20Cup">Cup Winners Cup</a>. In December 1969, he received a doctorate of dentistry. He played in the final of the first <a href="1973%E2%80%9374%20DFB-Pokal">DFB-Pokal</a> win of the eagles in 1974 against the <a href="Hamburger%20SV">Hamburger SV</a>. The next time <a href="1974%E2%80%9375%20DFB-Pokal">one year later</a> against <a href="MSV%20Duisburg">MSV Duisburg</a> he was a substitute.
With 1.73 metres, Kunter was some inches too small to seriously compete with his rivals in the <a href="Germany%20national%20football%20team">national team</a> (<a href="Sepp%20Maier">Maier</a>, <a href="Norbert%20Nigbur">Nigbur</a>, <a href="Wolfgang%20Kleff">Kleff</a>, <a href="Bernd%20Franke">Franke</a>) and never played for the senior national team.
Kunter retired in 1976. Between 1977 and 1979, he was vice chairman of <a href="Eintracht%20Frankfurt">Eintracht Frankfurt</a> and from 2001 until 2005 he was a member of the clubs' administrative board.
